channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Replica Harry Potter swords recalled over Japan’s strict weapons laws
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho
item.description: The decorative Gryffindor swords, sold by Warner Bros. Studio Tour Tokyo, fell foul of Japan’s weapons laws, which are among the strictest in the world.

item.title: Who are the key players fighting in Syria’s civil war?
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: Islamist rebel group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham launched a lightning assault against pro-Assad forces in Aleppo. Here’s who else is fighting in Syria’s civil war.

item.title: Vietnam court says tycoon must repay embezzled billions to avoid execution
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: An appeals court upheld Truong My Lan’s death sentence for bank fraud but suggested she could avoid execution by repaying three-quarters of the money she stole.

item.title: Revenge, fire and destruction: A year of Israeli soldiers’ videos from Gaza
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Sarah Cahlan, Jonathan Baran, Louisa Loveluck
item.description: The Post verified more than 120 photos and videos of the war in Gaza - providing an uncensored view of one of the most deadly and destructive wars in this century.

item.title: Starbucks and Nestlé face scrutiny over labor practices in China
item.dc:creator: Vic Chiang, Christian Shepherd
item.description: ‘Ghost’ coffee farms in Starbucks’ and Nestle’s supply chains in China are overworking farmers and allowing underaged labor, China Labor Watch has found.

item.title: Michelin chef appeals to Christmas spirit of thieves who stole 2,500 pies
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: “I know you’re a criminal, but maybe just do something nice because it’s Christmas,” said British chef Tommy Banks, after thieves stole a van full of pies.

item.title: Australian police seize country’s largest-ever cocaine bust
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Baker
item.description: Authorities in Australia announced the record-breaking bust on Monday.

item.title: Biden surges arms to Ukraine, fearing Trump will halt U.S. aid
item.dc:creator: Michael Birnbaum, Missy Ryan, Siobhán O'Grady
item.description: Biden’s Ukraine directive has stirred debate, as some officials worry it will cut too deeply into American stockpiles and jeopardize military needs elsewhere.

item.title: Israeli military strikes Lebanese targets after Hezbollah fires on Israel
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Niha Masih, Annabelle Timsit, Adam Taylor
item.description: The rebel offensive in Syria started after Israel and Hezbollah agreed to a cease-fire in Lebanon, where conflict has weakened key backers of Syria’s government.

item.title: U.S. citizen believed held hostage in Gaza was killed on Oct. 7, IDF says
item.dc:creator: Joanna Slater, Annabelle Timsit, Lior Soroka
item.description: Omer Neutra, a U.S.-Israeli citizen believed held hostage by Hamas, was killed on Oct. 7, 2023, the Israeli military said Monday.

item.title: Storm Bora brings days of flooding to Greece, with more rain ahead
item.dc:creator: Ian Livingston
item.description: The weather pattern fueling Storm Bora is similar to the one that caused severe flooding in Spain this fall.

item.title: From beer to barley: How Trump’s Mexico tariff threat could affect your wallet
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan, Valentina Muñoz Castillo
item.description: Donald Trump’s threat to hit Mexico with tariffs could raise prices on a surprising number of foods and drinks Americans love — from beer to berries to broccoli.

item.title: What led to Syria’s 13-year civil war, and why has fighting surged again?
item.dc:creator: Kelly Kasulis Cho, Kelsey Baker
item.description: The sudden assault by Syrian rebels has rapidly redrawn the civil war’s front lines and threatened once again the authority of President Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: Divided over whether to stop making plastic, U.N. treaty talks collapse
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: Delegates from more than 170 countries huddled for a week of marathon negotiations but came up short on delivering a treaty.

item.description: The rebels have made stunning gains against President Bashar al-Assad’s forces, with Russia, Iran and Hezbollah distracted by other conflicts.

item.title: Trump win emboldens Israeli settlers seeking control of the West Bank
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Adam Taylor
item.description: Israel’s extremist settlers see few barriers to their plans to rule the West Bank now that Trump is returning to the White House.
